answerText: Plasmodium[10] Besides invading red blood cells, the sporozoites of plasmodium invade the cells of this organ, where they mature into merozoites.
heading: VCU Closed |2013 | Haverford and Michigan State B | 15 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: People with the sickle cell trait or the Duffy antigen are more resistant to this organism, and among the proteins on its surface are the STEVOR antigen, PfEMP1, and MSP-1. For 10 points each: [10] Name this parasitic genus of apicomplexan parasites that cause malaria in humans and is frequently transmitted by the Anopheles genus of mosquito.
